unit.utterance: χalq' kːušlede daˁwila dusmacːebde
unit.utterance_translation: The people were hungry; this was during the years of war.

unit.utterance: dila zu wabše, knigalcːeb, selsawetlicːeb belk'unne bakːʷi
unit.utterance_translation: My name was not recorded at all, not in the book, not at the village head.

unit.utterance: kelgunda xuc'anu ʡaˁbra dus di... ʡaˁbra dussicːew
unit.utterance_translation: I was there in the year 1953.

unit.utterance: Istalin webč'ible, bisːul χalq'
unit.utterance_translation: When Stalin died, the people cried.

unit.utterance: webč'ible Istalin, mašinte, pojezde t'aš aʁible
unit.utterance_translation: When Stalin died, trains and cars were stopped.

unit.utterance: tːuːˁtː dik'ul duč'ini, daže hextːi duburtacːe t'ama hadaširi
unit.utterance_translation: They made tuuuut, the sound went even to the mountains.

unit.utterance: c'il heltːuw kelgunda, macːalsa waxul kalχuzla
unit.utterance_translation: I lived there, I looked after the sheep of the kolkhoz [i.e. worked as a shepherd].

unit.utterance: macːalsa wašibda, macːalːa aq'ra erdarq'ibda, c'ili heltːi macːa čiddet'ible,
unit.utterance_translation: I looked after the sheep, looked after the flock of sheep, then I got bored of the sheep.

unit.utterance: du dabrawolna armijale agurda, ʁajal dus wiχuble,
unit.utterance_translation: I voluntarily went to the army when I was 20,

unit.utterance: xuc'anu xuraib dusicːew.
unit.utterance_translation: in the year 55.

unit.utterance: xuc'anu xuraib dusicːew, armijale agurda du
unit.utterance_translation: In the year 55 I went to the army.

unit.utterance: wajankumatle agurre, bičːible zajawka
unit.utterance_translation: I went to the military registration and gave them the application.

unit.utterance: agurda ʡaˁrmijale, ilka hetːuwa witeʁibda
unit.utterance_translation: I went to the army, and then from there I went there.

unit.utterance: ca žumaˁʡ pojezdlew kelgunda, ca žumaˁʡ
unit.utterance_translation: For one week we stayed on the train, one week.

unit.utterance: Woronežle derčibda čirkadaturre, Woronežle,
unit.utterance_translation: They brought us to Voronezh, they let us off the train in Voronezh.

unit.utterance: Woronežled kelgunda ca bacdel k'ʷel bacdel, abalχad, saweʁib ca kapitan
unit.utterance_translation: In Voronezh we stayed one or two months, I don't remember, then a captain came.

unit.utterance: kapitan sajʁib, wallah, saldat ʡaˁʁnil caw ik'ʷar
unit.utterance_translation: A captain came, and he said, by God, I need soldiers.

unit.utterance: nušːa balnicala karidorre kadicːullede rjadlicːella saldat kamisːijale diduˁq'ij
unit.utterance_translation: We stood in the corridor of the hospital, a row of soldiers, to go to the commissariat.

unit.utterance: saač'ible belč'un ilil Gadžimuradow takoj, i takoj takoj
unit.utterance_translation: He came and read, Gadzhimuradov [i.e. the surname of the speaker] and such and such.

unit.utterance: sukːilra nušːa heltːi darginci gučidaˁqibda helil
unit.utterance_translation: He gathered all of us Dargi people.

unit.utterance: urč'emal saldat tːurasaaʁible, čina daxantedaja?
unit.utterance_translation: Nine soldiers went outside, where should we go?

unit.utterance: derčibda astalawajle, qarala kaš lebde, qarala kaš
unit.utterance_translation: (He) brought us to the canteen, there was pea porridge, pea porridge.

unit.utterance: buc'arre hel berkʷij ajχuble, babq'i berkunne babq'i aberkunne; gurhaderč'ibda helil
unit.utterance_translation: It was hot, and I wasn't able to eat it, I ate half of it, and half of it I did not eat, and then he made us stand up.

unit.utterance: hel gurajcːur zamana dila ulbe het kašled kelgun
unit.utterance_translation: When I got up, at that time, my eyes remained on the porridge.

unit.utterance: du welqːunnekːʷiq'al, nu vse rawno kelgun
unit.utterance_translation: I didn't eat until I was full, and so the porridge remained.

unit.utterance: derčible pojezdle čikadaturda daˁrχaˁlla
unit.utterance_translation: (He) led us on the train, put us on the train in the evening.

unit.utterance: sačibda daˁrχaˁ zamana saˁʡaˁt wec'nu k'ʷira leddel aχːu ce caddel Kuriskile
unit.utterance_translation: (They) brought us in the evening, it was at twelve or something, I don't know what time it was, to Kursk.

unit.utterance: Kuriski wokzalle čirkadaturre, telepun daˁqible sačib čula mašin
unit.utterance_translation: At the station in Kursk they let us out of the train, they made a phone call, and got their car.

unit.utterance: čikadaturda nušːa mašinne, derčibda kazarmale
unit.utterance_translation: They sat us in the car and brought us to the barracks.

unit.utterance: nu, kanišno, dila gub kelgun, dam heltːud ʡuˁrus ʁaj dalχul akːʷadi sawsem
unit.utterance_translation: Well, certainly, I had [UNCLEAR], there I did not know Russian at all.

unit.utterance: ʡuˁrus ʁaj dalχul akːʷadi
unit.utterance_translation: I did not know the Russian language.

unit.utterance: ʁaj bik'ulcab heltːi, dam heltːi ʁajla luʁat irʁul akːʷadi
unit.utterance_translation: They are talking and I do not understand the words of their language.

unit.utterance: očen qihinnede dam, qihinne, c'aq'le
unit.utterance_translation: It was very difficult for me, very difficult.

unit.utterance: c'ilra heltːi bahla-bahlal ʁajra daχurre, bahla-bahlal islužbara biqːul
unit.utterance_translation: Then slowly I learned the language and I did my (military) service.

unit.utterance: du, barxle bursille, ʡaˁbal dus kelgunda, du gaupaχtle akajčibda ca saˁʡaˁt
unit.utterance_translation: To be honest [lit. if I say it directly], I stayed for three years, and I was not one single hour at the guardhouse.

unit.utterance: dul islužba, c'aq'le paslužanni admide du
unit.utterance_translation: I, the service, I was a very obedient person.

unit.utterance: qːaraʔullew kelgunda, rota aχrande
unit.utterance_translation: I was in the guard, I was in a guard company.

unit.utterance: ca dučːi kazarmaled dirχʷadi ca dučːi, aχranne aχranjat dik'ʷadi
unit.utterance_translation: One night we were staying in the barracks, one night we were at the guard, watching.

unit.utterance: ganilːa c'aq'le buχːarre birχʷiri, χːulace duˁħi birq'iri, č'an birχʷiri, nu...
unit.utterance_translation: In the winter it was very cold, it snowed a lot, there was wind...

unit.utterance: ʡaˁbal dus islužit iχubda hetːuw du
unit.utterance_translation: I served there for three years.

unit.utterance: sabeʁib, wallah bik'ʷar, šaχtalcːe daxante bik'ʷar, dabrawulcabe dawaj
unit.utterance_translation: They came and said, by God, let's have some volunteers to go to the mine.

unit.utterance: na damra hanbičib waxanda q'ʷila arc dirq'anda
unit.utterance_translation: And I thought, I should go and make a little money.

unit.utterance: ruqna aba lerde dila, abaj dalli diqːanda ik'ul
unit.utterance_translation: My mother was old, I thought, I would take my mother with me.

unit.utterance: dura heltːacːella walli
unit.utterance_translation: I got together with them.

unit.utterance: xujal duˁrħuˁ ledde nušːa, ʡaˁbal nušːa daʁistannade k'ʷel ʡuˁrus duˁrħuˁde
unit.utterance_translation: We were five guys, three from Daghestan and two Russian guys.

unit.utterance: agurda šaχtalcːe, šaχtacːed dirq'ul kelgunda
unit.utterance_translation: We went into the mine, stayed and worked in the mine.

unit.utterance: ca bar dila t'up mot'orricːe bibičible qːurt bitarq'ibil, c'ip čiraʁib
unit.utterance_translation: One day my finger ended up in an engine, when I was pushing, and it was cut off.

unit.utterance: iltːuw kelgunda aʁʷc'al bar banːičnilew
unit.utterance_translation: I stayed forty days in the hospital there.

unit.utterance: hetːur c'ili du gursaač'ibda qili
unit.utterance_translation: Then from there I went back home.

unit.utterance: gursaač'ibda, dul padjemni arc haasːibtede
unit.utterance_translation: I came back and took the travel allowances.

unit.utterance: nu hana han dilakːu čumdel azir qːurušdel ce caddel dičːib padjemni bik'ul
unit.utterance_translation: Now I do not remember how much it was, a thousand roubles or whatever it was, they gave it (to me), saying, allowances.

unit.utterance: heltːi dičːible, qili saač'ibda
unit.utterance_translation: (They) gave it (to me), and I went home.

unit.utterance: qiliw kelgunda ca bacdel k'ʷel bacdel aχːu
unit.utterance_translation: I stayed for one or two months at home, I don't know.

unit.utterance: habeʁib, parkuror, wallah u činajal agurre, waˁwbik'ulcab bik'ul, Urkaraqaraj agurda du
unit.utterance_translation: Then people came and said that the public prosecutor calls you, by God, you went somewhere, and I went to Ukarakh.
unit.add_comments: DF: all verbs with HPL agreement refer to the people who came to him and told him what the prosecutor had said; there is no verb agreeing with the noun prosecutor.

unit.utterance: cellij saruqunde u, cellij?
unit.utterance_translation: [They asked,] why did you run away, why?

unit.utterance: hek', hek'tːi arc hil lukːanteja?
unit.utterance_translation: Who should give this money (back)?

unit.utterance: arc lukːanteq'al dul.
unit.utterance_translation: I have to give the money back.

unit.utterance: čirlukːantecad
unit.utterance_translation: It must be given back.

unit.utterance: uː, haʔibda, dila qal ʡuˁt'buquncab, qiliw čak'al waːkːu, aba rebč'iblecar
unit.utterance_translation: Oh, I said, my house has fallen to pieces, there is nobody at home, my mother died.

unit.utterance: ladna ik'ʷar, padpis barq'a heštːu, padpis barq'ibda heltːira kelgun, dura
unit.utterance_translation: Well, he says, sign here, and I signed these (documents) and remained, and I also...

unit.utterance: xuc'anu urč'emra ʔibil dusːicːew, urcegc'al ʔibillicːew karižible xːunulra dura
unit.utterance_translation: In the year 59, in 60 I got married.

unit.utterance: hana ištːu sajʁij satːina kelgunda
unit.utterance_translation: Until I came here, I remained (in Sanzhi village).

unit.utterance: nu c'ili ʡaˁħle eriχubda du
unit.utterance_translation: Then I lived well.

unit.utterance: šupira kurs belč'unda, šupira kurslicːelːa, guž ʡaˁči abarq'ibda, waxul raboči bikul sabikul
unit.utterance_translation: I learned at the driver's course, I didn't do hard work, I went and brought the workers [to the wine factory] and brought them back again.

unit.utterance: wec'nu k'ʷira dus zawodler čaˁʁir dikadi
unit.utterance_translation: I worked for 12 years in the wine factory.

unit.utterance: čaˁʁirlicːella ʡaˁħlede; wot helitːe hana hežsatːina sajʁijsatːina agur
unit.utterance_translation: With the wine it was good. Well, like this, this is what has happened until now.
